alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 7:18AM EST until December 19 at 4:25AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Hunterdon and Somerset Counties. For the Raritan River...including Stanton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River at Stanton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. At 10.0 feet, Houses downstream begin to take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Monday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.0 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 10/09/1903. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 10.4 Mon 7 am 7.0 4.7 10.10 7am 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EST.
